text: The 1926 Washington State Cougars football team was an American football team that represented Washington State College during the 1926 college football season. Head coach Babe Hollingbery led the team to a 4–1 mark in the PCC and 6–1 overall. ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Opponent ! scope="col" | Location ! scope="col" | Score ! scope="col" | Attendance |- ! scope="row" | October 2 | College of Idaho | Home | 35-0 W | 1,500 |- ! scope="row" | October 9 | USC | Away | 7-16 L | NA |- ! scope="row" | October 16 | Montana | Home | 14-6 W | 2,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 23 | Washington | Away | 9-6 W | 28,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 6 | Idaho | Away | 6-0 W | 5,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 13 | Oregon | Home | 7-0 W | 8,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 25 | Gonzaga | Away | 7-0 W | 10,000 |} ==References== Washington State Category:Washington State Cougars football seasons Category:1926 in Washington (state)
